bug.author: SulaimanSnoma
bug.description:
I am trying to install FARM-HAYSTACK several time via pip on window 10 using both command prompt, anaconda prompt and jupyter notebook but experiencing the below error. Please how do I resolve the error? pip install farm-haystack Collecting farm-haystack Using cached farm-haystack-0.2.1.tar.gz (30 kB) Collecting farm==0.4.3 Using cached farm-0.4.3.tar.gz (153 kB) Collecting fastapi Using cached fastapi-0.58.0-py3-none-any.whl (49 kB) Collecting uvicorn Using cached uvicorn-0.11.5-py3-none-any.whl (43 kB) Collecting gunicorn Using cached gunicorn-20.0.4-py2.py3-none-any.whl (77 kB) Requirement already satisfied: pandas in c:\users
cc\anaconda3\lib\site-packages (from farm-haystack) (1.0.1) Collecting psycopg2-binary Using cached psycopg2_binary-2.8.5-cp37-cp37m-win_amd64.whl (1.1 MB) Collecting sklearn Using cached sklearn-0.0.tar.gz (1.1 kB) Collecting elasticsearch Using cached elasticsearch-7.7.1-py2.py3-none-any.whl (99 kB) Collecting elastic-apm Using cached elastic_apm-5.7.0-py3-none-any.whl (447 kB) Collecting coverage Using cached coverage-5.1-cp37-cp37m-win_amd64.whl (205 kB) Requirement already satisfied: setuptools in c:\users
cc\anaconda3\lib\site-packages (from farm==0.4.3->farm-haystack) (47.3.1) Requirement already satisfied: wheel in c:\users
cc\anaconda3\lib\site-packages (from farm==0.4.3->farm-haystack) (0.34.2) Note: you may need to restart the kernel to use updated packages. ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement torch==1.4.0 (from farm==0.4.3->farm-haystack) (from versions: 0.1.2, 0.1.2.post1, 0.1.2.post2) ERROR: No matching distribution found for torch==1.4.0 (from farm==0.4.3->farm-haystack) <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67034710/84960740-57d34e80-b0fa-11ea-9ff3-61306a91e6d5.png></denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/SulaimanSnoma>@SulaimanSnoma</denchmark-link> , thank you for raising the issue. It should now be resolved with <denchmark-link:https://github.com/deepset-ai/haystack/pull/159>#159</denchmark-link> .
